articles.author: ANDREW DALTON
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — The union representing screenwriters reached a tentative agreement with Hollywood studios to end a historic strike after nearly five months, raising hopes that a crippling shutdown of movie and television filming could be near an end.
articles.title: Writers' union reaches tentative deal with Hollywood studios to end historic strike

articles.author: PAUL J. WEBER
articles.description: AUSTIN, Texas (AP) — A white Texas gunman who killed 23 people at a Walmart in 2019 after ranting about Hispanics taking over the government and economy has agreed to pay more than $5 million to victims of the racist attack, according to an order signed by a judge Monday.
articles.title: Texas Walmart shooter agrees to pay more than $5M to families over 2019 racist attack

articles.author: JENNIFER SINCO KELLEHER
articles.description: LAHAINA, Hawaii (AP) — Some Lahaina residents returned to their devastated properties Monday for the first time since the Hawaii town was destroyed by wildfire nearly seven weeks ago.
articles.title: Lahaina residents begin returning to sites of homes destroyed by deadly wildfire

articles.author: DEEPTI HAJELA and MIKE CATALINI
articles.description: UNION CITY, N.J. (AP) — Democratic U.S. Sen. Bob Menendez of New Jersey defiantly pushed back against federal corruption charges on Monday, saying nearly half a million dollars in cash authorities found in his home was from his personal savings, not from bribes, and was on hand for emergencies.
articles.title: Democratic Sen. Menendez rejects calls to resign and says cash found in home was not bribe proceeds

articles.author: MATTHEW PERRONE
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Food and Drug Administration meets this week to consider approval of an experimental treatment for Lou Gehrig’s disease, the culmination of a yearslong lobbying effort by patients with the fatal neurodegenerative disease.
articles.title: Experimental treatment pushed by ALS patients gets day before FDA, but agency unconvinced it works

articles.author: JILL COLVIN
articles.description: SUMMERVILLE, S.C. (AP) — Former President Donald Trump ramped up his campaign schedule with a visit to South Carolina on Monday after a busy weekend online that included threats to the media, multiple accusations of treason and a claim he could design a better fighter jet than the military.
articles.title: Trump campaigns in South Carolina after a weekend spent issuing threats and leveling treason claims

articles.author: TAMMY WEBBER and LINLEY SANDERS
articles.description: Kathleen Maxwell has lived in Phoenix for more than 20 years, but this summer was the first time she felt fear, as daily high temperatures soared to 110 degrees or hotter and kept it up for a record-shattering 31 consecutive days.
articles.title: After summer's extreme weather, more Americans see climate change as a culprit, AP-NORC poll shows

articles.author: CHRISTOPHER RUGABER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Last year's spike in inflation, to the highest level in four decades, was painful enough for American households.
articles.title: Why the US job market has defied rising interest rates and expectations of high unemployment

articles.author: HEATHER HOLLINGSWORTH
articles.description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo. (AP) — It's a Monday in September, but with schools closed, the three children in the Pruente household have nowhere to be. Callahan, 13, contorts herself into a backbend as 7-year-old Hudson fiddles with a balloon and 10-year-old Keegan plays the piano.
articles.title: More schools are adopting 4-day weeks. For parents, the challenge is day 5

articles.author: LAURA UNGAR and MADDIE BURAKOFF
articles.description: Neanderthals live on within us.These ancient human cousins, and others called Denisovans, once lived alongside our early Homo sapiens ancestors.
articles.title: We carry DNA from extinct cousins like Neanderthals. Science is now revealing their genetic legacy
